name: printed wiring board mounting facility construction, surface mounting line | printed wiring board mounting facility, surface mounting line | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4193/documentation

This dataset represents a unit of an example of a SMT mounting line – comprising 3 small component placing machines, 2 big components placing machines, 1 inspection device and 1 reflow oven  with a total weight of 19’300 kg. Main data of weight are taken from producer information of such machines, composition, infrastructure and production efforts are based on own assumptions. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of raw materials at the factory gate.

This dataset includes material, production efforts (material treatment processes),  infrastructure for the production of all the machineries used for the mouning of surface mount components onto a printed wiring board. No information about emissions (air, water) and waste are included.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent a global valid composition of a SMT mounting line
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical data of current machines sold for the mounting of SMD components.

exchanges.description:
A typical SMT mounting line comprises the following types of machines: screen print machine, small component placement machine(s), large component placement machine(s), inspection equipment and at the end a reflow oven.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
